process-def.name: :RBA-AD-VMware_Infrastructure:Utilities:VM_Configuration_Operations:Construct Item for Clone VM with Custom Settings

input.description: virtual machine VirtualMachine used to make the method call
folder Folder of the new virtual machine.
datacenter Datacenter name
clone name The name of the new virtual machine.
virtual machine datastore [optional] Datastore where the virtual machine should be located. If not specified, the current datastore is used.
resource pool [optional] The resource pool to which this virtual machine should be attached. If the argument is not supplied, the current resource pool of virtual machine is used.

host [optional] DNS name of the target host for the virtual machine. If not specified, -if resource pool is not specified, current host is used. -if resource pool is specified, and the target pool represents a stand-alone host, the host is used. -if resource pool is specified, and the target pool represents a DRS-enabled cluster, a host selected by DRS is used. -if resource pool is specified and the target pool represents a cluster without DRS enabled, an InvalidArgument exception be thrown.

disk list [optional] An optional list that allows specifying the datastore location for each virtual disk. Value takes the form :
<disk-list> <disk> <datastore></datastore> <disk-id></disk-id> </disk> <disk> <datastore></datastore> <disk-id></disk-id> </disk> ....... </disk-list>

transform [optional] Transformation to perform on the disks. The backend is free to ignore this hint if it is not valid for the current operation. This can be used by clients, for example, to create sparse disks for templates.
valid values: flat, sparse

template [optional] Specifies whether or not the new virtual machine should be marked as a template.
valid values: true, false
virtual machine version [optional] The version string for this virtual machine.
guest OS [optional] Guest operating system.
annotation [optional] User-provided description of the virtual machine.
tools version [optional] Version of VMware Tools installed on the guest operating system.

run tools after power on [optional] Flag to specify whether or not scripts should run after the virtual machine powers on.
valid values: true, false

run tools after resume [optional] Flag to specify whether or not scripts should run after the virtual machine resumes.
valid values: true, false

run tools before guest standby [optional] Flag to specify whether or not scripts should run before the virtual machine suspends
valid values: true, false

run tools before guest reboot [optional] Flag to specify whether or not scripts should run before the virtual machine reboots.
valid values: true, false

run tools before guest shutdown [optional] Flag to specify whether or not scripts should run before the virtual machine powers off.
valid values: true, false

disable acceleration flag [optional] Flag to turn off video acceleration for a virtual machine console window.
valid values: true, false

enable logging flag [optional] Flag to enable logging for a virtual machine.
valid values: true, false

use toe flag [optional] Flag to specify whether or not to use TOE (TCP/IP Offloading).
valid values: true, false

run with debug info flag [optional] Flag to specify whether or not to run in debug mode.
valid values: true, false

hyperthread sharing [optional] Specifies how the VCPUs of a virtual machine are allowed to share physical cores on a hyperthreaded system. Two VCPUs are "sharing" a core if they are both running on logical CPUs of the core at the same time.
valid values: any, internal, none

power on when opened [optional] Power on the virtual machine when it is opened in the console.
valid values: true, false

enter full screen on power on [optional] Enter full screen mode when this virtual machine is powered on.
valid values: true, false
input.from: enter full screen on power on
input.to: enter full screen on power on

input.description:
close on power off or suspend [optional] Close the console application when the virtual machine is powered off or suspended.
valid values: true, false
input.from: close on power off or suspend
input.to: close on power off or suspend

input.description: power off type [optional] Describes the default power off type for this virtual machine. The possible values are specified by the PowerOpType. hard - Perform power off by using the PowerOff method. soft - Perform power off by using the ShutdownGuest method. preset - The preset value is specified in the defaultPowerOffType section. This setting is advisory and clients can choose to ignore it.

suspend type [optional] Describes the default suspend type for this virtual machine. The possible values are specified by the PowerOpType. hard - Perform suspend by using the Suspend method. soft - Perform suspend by using the StandbyGuest method. preset - The preset value is specified in the defaultSuspendType section. This setting is advisory and clients can choose to ignore it.

reset type [optional] Describes the default reset type for this virtual machine. The possible values are specified by the PowerOpType. hard - Perform reset by using the Reset method. soft - Perform reset by using the RebootGuest method. preset - The preset value is specified in the defaultResetType section. This setting is advisory and clients can choose to ignore it.
default power off type [optional] Default operation for power off: soft or hard
default suspend type [optional] Default operation for suspend: soft or hard
default reset type [optional] Default operation for reset: soft or hard.
stand by action [optional] Behavior of virtual machine when it receives the S1 ACPI call.
number of CPUs [optional] Number of virtual processors in a virtual machine.
memory in MB [optional] Size of a virtual machine's memory, in MB

device change list [optional] Set of virtual devices being added/removed by the configuration operation.
Value takes the form: <device-change-list> <!--Zero or more repetitions:--> <device-change> <operation>?</operation> <file-operation>?</file-operation> <device xsi:type=""> <key>0</key> <device-info> <label>?</label> <summary>?</summary> </device-info> <backing xsi:type=""> <file-name>?</file-name> <disk-mode>?</disk-mode> <split>?</split> <write-through>?</write-through> <thin-provisioned>?</thin-provisioned> <device-name>?</device-name> <exclusive>?</exclusive> </backing> <connectable> <start-connected>?</start-connected> <allow-guest-control>?</allow-guest-control> <connected>?</connected> </connectable> <controller-key>?</controller-key> <unit-number>?</unit-number> <bus-number>?</bus-number> <device>?</device> <shared-bus>?</shared-bus> <capacityInKB>?</capacityInKB> <address-type>?</address-type> <mac-address>?</mac-address> <wake-on-lan-enabled>?</wake-on-lan-enabled> </device> </device-change> <device-change> ....... </device-change> <device-change-list>
label: Device name to be removed from the new cloned machine.
Note: It is necessary to provide empty tags for the xml.
Valid values for controllerType:
VirtualPCIController, VirtualBusLogicController, VirtualLsiLogicController
Valid values for deviceType: VirtualDisk, VirtualE1000, VirtualPCNet32, VirtualVmxnet.

CPU allocation reservation [optional] Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to the virtual machine or resource pool. Reserved resources are not wasted if they are not used. If the utilization is less than the reservation, the resources can be utilized by other running virtual machines. Unit is MHz.

CPU allocation limit [optional] The utilization of a virtual machine/resource pool will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources. This is typically used to ensure a consistent performance of virtual machines / resource pools independent of available resources. If set to -1, then there is no fixed limit on resource usage (only bounded by available resources and shares). Unit is MHz.

CPU allocation shares [optional] The number of shares allocated. Used to determine resource allocation in case of resource contention. This value is only set if level is set to custom. If level is not set to custom, this value is ignored. Therefore, only shares with custom values can be compared. There is no unit for this value. It is a relative measure based on the settings for other resource pools.

CPU allocation level [optional] The allocation level. The level is a simplified view of shares. Levels map to a pre-determined set of numeric values for shares. If the shares value does not map to a predefined size, then the level is set as custom.
valid values: custom - Shares are specified in the "shares" column. high - Shares = 2000 * number of virtual CPUs low - Shares = 500 * number of virtual CPUs normal - Shares = 1000 * number of virtual CPUs

memory allocation reservation [optional] Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to the virtual machine or resource pool. Reserved resources are not wasted if they are not used. If the utilization is less than the reservation, the resources can be utilized by other running virtual machines. Unit is MB.

memory allocation limit [optional] The utilization of a virtual machine/resource pool will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources. This is typically used to ensure a consistent performance of virtual machines / resource pools independent of available resources. If set to -1, then there is no fixed limit on resource usage (only bounded by available resources and shares). Unit is MB.

memory allocation shares [optional] The number of shares allocated. Used to determine resource allocation in case of resource contention. This value is only set if level is set to custom. If level is not set to custom, this value is ignored. Therefore, only shares with custom values can be compared. There is no unit for this value. It is a relative measure based on the settings for other resource pools.

memory allocation level [optional] The allocation level. The level is a simplified view of shares. Levels map to a pre-determined set of numeric values for shares. If the shares value does not map to a predefined size, then the level is set as custom.
valid values: custom - Shares are specified in the "shares" column. high - Shares =Shares = 20 * virtual machine memory size in megabytes low - Shares = 5 * virtual machine memory size in megabytes normal - Shares = 10 * virtual machine memory size in megabytes

CPU affinity set list [optional] List of nodes (processors for CPU) that may be used by the virtual machine. If the array is empty when modifying the affinity setting, then any existing affinity is removed.
Value takes the form:
<affinity-set-list> <affinity-set></affinity-set> <affinity-set></affinity-set> ............. </affinity-set-list>

memory affinity set list [optional] List of nodes ( NUMA nodes for memory) that may be used by the virtual machine. If the array is empty when modifying the affinity setting, then any existing affinity is removed.
Value takes the form:
<affinity-set-list> <affinity-set></affinity-set> <affinity-set></affinity-set> ............. </affinity-set-list>

network shaper enabled [optional] Is the shaper enabled?
valid values: true, false
network peak bps [optional] Peak bandwidth, in bits per second.
network average bps [optional] Average bandwidth, in bits per second.
network burst size [optional] Burst size, in bytes.

CPU feature mask list [optional] Specifies the CPU feature compatibility masks.
Value takes the form:
<cpu-feature-mask-list> <cpu-feature-mask> <operation>add</operation> <info> <level></level> <vendor>amd</vendor> <eax></eax> <ebx></ebx> <ecx></ecx> <edx></edx> </info> </cpu-feature-mask> <cpu-feature-mask> <operation>add</operation> <info> <level></level> <vendor></vendor> <eax></eax> <ebx></ebx> <ecx></ecx> <edx></edx> </info> </cpu-feature-mask> ............ </cpu-feature-mask-list>
operation: The type of operation being performed on the specified virtual device. Valid values: add
level: Level (EAX input to CPUID). Valid values: Number
vendor: Used if this mask is for a particular vendor. Valid values: String
eax: String representing the required EAX bits Valid values: String
ebx: String representing the required EBX bits Valid values: String
ecx: String representing the required ECX bits. Valid values: String
edx: String representing the required EDX bits. Valid values: String

power on [optional] Specifies whether or not the new VirtualMachine should be powered on after creation. As part of a customization, this flag is normally set to true, since the first power-on operation completes the customization process. This flag is ignored if a template is being created.
valid values: true, false

Network identity and settings, similar to Microsoft's Sysprep tool. This is a Sysprep, LinuxPrep, or SysprepText object.
Valid Values: CustomizationLinuxPrep, CustomizationSysprep.

The XML input is as follows
<password> <value>aaa</value> <plain-text>true</plain-text> </password>
The new administrator password for the machine.
password: The new administrator password for the machine value: The password string. It is encrypted if the associated plainText flag is false. plain-text: Flag to specify whether or not the password is in plain text, rather than encrypted. (valid values true and false)

The time zone for the new virtual machine. Numbers correspond to time zones listed in sysprep documentation in Microsoft Technet.
Valid value: int

Flag to determine whether or not the machine automatically logs on as Administrator. See also the password property.
Valid Value: Boolean

If the AutoLogon flag is set, then the AutoLogonCount property specifies the number of times the machine should automatically log on as Administrator. Generally it should be 1, but if your setup requires a number of reboots, you may want to increase it. This number may be determined by the list of commands executed by the GuiRunOnce command.
Valid value: int

User's full name.
Valid value: String
Mandatory when identity type is "CustomizationSysprep"

User's organization.
Valid value: String
Mandatory when identity type is "CustomizationSysprep"

The computer name of the (Windows) virtual machine.
Valid value: <computer-name> <name></name> </computer-name>
Mandatory when identity type is "CustomizationSysprep"

Microsoft Sysprep requires that a valid serial number be included in the answer file when mini-setup runs. This serial number is ignored if the original guest operating system was installed using a volume-licensed CD.
Valid value: String

A list of commands to run at first user logon, after guest customization.
XML Format:
<gui-run-once> <!-- one or more--> <command></command> <command></command> </gui-run-once>

The workgroup that the virtual machine should join. If this value is supplied, then the domain name and authentication fields must be empty.
Valid value: String

Server licensing mode.
Valid value: perSeat, perServer
input.from: license file print data auto mode
input.to: license file print data auto mode

input.description:
This key is valid only if AutoMode = PerServer. The integer value indicates the number of client licenses purchased for the VirtualCenter server being installed.
Valid value: int
input.from: license file print data auto users
input.to: license file print data auto users

input.description:
The computer name of the (Non-Windows) virtual machine.
Valid value: <host-name> <name></name> </host-name>
Mandatory when identity type is "CustomizationLinuxPrep"

The fully qualified domain name.
Valid value: String
Mandatory when identity type is "CustomizationLinuxPrep"

List of DNS servers, for a virtual network adapter with a static IP address. If this list is empty, then the guest operating system is expected to use a DHCP server to get its DNS server settings. These settings configure the virtual machine to use the specified DNS servers. These DNS server settings are listed in order of preference. If you supply this list, be sure to specify that dnsFromDhcp is false.
Valid value: <dns-server-list> <dns-server-list></dns-server-list> <dns-server-list></dns-server-list> </dns-server-list>

List of name resolution suffixes for the virtual network adapter. This list applies to both Windows and Linux guest customization. For Linux, this setting is global, whereas in Windows, this setting is listed on a per-adapter basis, even though the setting is global in Windows.
Valid value: <dns-suffix-list> <dns-suffix-list></dns-suffix-list> <dns-suffix-list></dns-suffix-list> </dns-suffix-list>

Specification to obtain a unique IP address for this virtual network adapter.
ip type: CustomizationDhcpIpGenerator, CustomizationFixedIp
Valid value: <ip type=""> <ipAddress></ipAddress> </ip>

Subnet mask for this virtual network adapter.
Valid value: String
For a virtual network adapter with a static IP address, this data object type contains a list of gateways, in order of preference.

A DNS domain suffix such as vmware.com.
Valid value: String

NIC Setting map list [optional] Set of Network Adapters to be added in the cloned virtual machine
Value takes the form:
<nic-setting-map-list> <!--Zero or more repetitions:--> <nic-setting-map> <adapter> <ip type="?"> <ipAddress>?</ipAddress> </ip> <subnet-mask>?</subnet-mask> <gateway>?</gateway> <dns-domain>?</dns-domain> </adapter> </nic-setting-map> </nic-setting-map-list>
Valid values for IP type attribute:
CustomizationFixedIp CustomizationDhcpIpGenerator
Note: <ipAddress> is valid only when the value for <ip type> is CustomizationFixedIp.
Note:
The <ip>, <subnet-mask>, <gateway> and <dns-domain> elements are children of the <nic-setting-map> element. To add a single network adapter element (<nic-setting-map>), fill in the values in the above four elements. To add multiple netwrok adapters (multiple <nic-setting-map>), use the <nic-setting-map-list> element.
If <nic-setting-map-list> is provided, the same is added to the customization XML, if <nic-setting-map-list> is not provided and any of the <ip>, <subnet-mask>, <gateway> and <dns-domain> elements is not null, then a single <nic-setting-map> is added to the customization XML.
If both are provided then only the <nic-setting-map-list> element is added.
Further note that the <nic-setting-map-list> element can be used to define a single netwrok adapter also.

input.from: enter full screen on power on
input.to: enter full screen on power on

input.from: close on power off or suspend
input.to: close on power off or suspend

input.from: license file print data auto mode
license file print data auto mode
license file print data auto users
license file print data auto users
license file print data auto mode
input.to: license file print data auto mode

input.from: license file print data auto users
input.to: license file print data auto user

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <item> <parameters> <virtual-machine>${virtual machine}</virtual-machine> <folder>${folder}</folder> <datacenter>${datacenter}</datacenter> <name>${clone name}</name> <spec> ${location} <template>${template}</template> <power-on>${power on}</power-on> ${config}${customization} </spec> </parameters> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Constructs <items> for Clone VM with Custom Settings operation
